intro: Chironia chloroides, commonly known as the green chironia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, achene-like seeds. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in humid climates.
